title: How to Make Green Tea Taste Better

steps.headline: Follow the instructions written on the packaging.
steps.description: Most green teas that you buy in the supermarket are brewed with a water temperature of 212°F (100°C) and are steeped for 2 minutes. However many green teas have to be brewed at a lower temperature like 149-158°F (65-70°C) and have to be steeped shorter; otherwise they might become too bitter. Many can be brewed several as seen in the picture. The first time steep for 45sec., the second time for 5-10 sec. and the last time for 15 seconds.

steps.headline: Store the tea properly.
steps.description: To ensure that the taste doesn't change and that no harmful substances develop, you have to store the tea safely. Keep it in an environment without light, heat, air, odors, or moisture.

steps.headline: Buy the right tea.
steps.description:
If you want to have good quality and taste then buy green tea from a local tea shop or order it on the internet. It's better to use loose leaves than teabags because the taste will develop better. There different kinds of green tea. For example:
Gunpowder, which has a slightly smoky flavor
Sencha, which has a natural sweetness
Gyokuro, which has sweet, slightly vegetative flavor.

steps.headline: Add sweeteners.
steps.description: To sweeten the tea, use honey, sugar or other sweeteners. Don't use too much or the flavor will be spoiled.

steps.headline: Consider flavoured tea.
steps.description: A flavoured tea has an extra flavour added to make it tastier. Such flavours are cinnamon, orange peel, lavender or superfoods. They have the same health benefits and even more antioxidants when superfoods are added.

steps.headline: In the end, just enjoy a good cup of tea.
